messages: 567019b22d591941a59844a7ed6970b7 (01:48): how do I clear a register once I've appended to it?
4b0ff45a522876ef79987d48421d9fd3 (01:49): let it equal ""
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (01:54): bah, using "" is lame, this is 1337 ... :let @a=@_ ;)
567019b22d591941a59844a7ed6970b7 (02:04): oh, A and a are the same register...
567019b22d591941a59844a7ed6970b7 (02:11): This does not seem to work :g/^task/"Eyy as register E contains nothing
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:12): :yy is not a command
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:12): :y[ank] is what you are looking for, I suppose
42857cbfdc1d5e00b2d7d10b0e4b7731 (02:24): i guess you could do :g/^task/normal "Eyy
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:28): why messing with normal if you don't have to
567019b22d591941a59844a7ed6970b7 (02:33): clear a register "ay0
567019b22d591941a59844a7ed6970b7 (02:33): append all lines matching pattern to reg a :g/pattern/y A
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:34): the clear only works if you're already at the beginning of the line
567019b22d591941a59844a7ed6970b7 (02:34): why it is y A rather than Ay I don't know
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:35): microm: since you can specify a range for :yank
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:36): and having :[register]yank [range] would be confusing as it disregards the convention of having range before the command
dcfc5b5134f4fc3b718ab15c2f0e1001 (02:45): http://download.al-islaam.com/audiovideo/anasheedram/al-islaam/html/samtan/lastbreath.swf
abe59155aa41ae19e4ea964e9dd4b200 (02:50): http://www.bagdadsoftware.de")
